result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius L Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 19CF573
Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by
agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of
probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable
employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled
substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly. Do not
drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given.
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Must comply
with all family court orders. Defendant ordered not to
possess or control any weapons.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darius L Gordon

records.addlTxt: Return to sender - Not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward.    NOH

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darius L Gordon in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Darius L Gordon. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 19CF573 Ct 2, Ct 3 without repeater, Ct 5 without repeater- GUILTY.
20CF1146 Cts 1, 2 & 3- GUILTY. 
21CF1217 Cts 1 & 2 without repeaters- GUILTY. 
22CF181 Cts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6 without repeaters- GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaints. 
BTC: 19CF573 Ct 2, Ct 3 without repeater, Ct 5 without repeater GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in.  20CF1146 Cts 1, 2 & 3 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 21CF1217 Cts 1 & 2 without repeaters GUILTY with Ct 3 being dismissed and read read in. 22CF181 Cts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6 without repeaters GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 19CF647 will be dismissed and read in. 
Part of the agreement was the State would stand silent so there is no sentencing argument from the State. 
Defense give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
19CF573-
Ct 2- 
3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count concurrent to each other. 
2 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 days Racine County Jail STAYED
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with the victim in 19CF573 with agent approval and expressed consent of the victim. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed.
Must comply with family court orders.
Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is eligible for CIP
Defendant is eligible for SAP. 

Cts 3 & 5-
60 days Racine County Jail concurrent with Ct 2. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

20CF1146-
Cts 1-3-
3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count concurrent to each other.
2 years probation.

21CF1217-
3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count concurrent to each other.
2 years probation.

22CF181-
Ct 1- 3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count concurrent to each other but consecutive to 19CF573.
2 years probation.

Cts 2-5
4 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 2 years initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed on each count concurrent to each other.

Ct 6- time served
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darius L Gordon in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Darius L Gordon. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address Defense's motion to modify bond. 
Defense gives further statement as to request as outlined in motion. 
State objects to modification and gives statement as to why. 
Defense requests COP date. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: DENIED, matter set over for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defense's
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darius L Gordon in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Darius L Gordon. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense has been in conversations with the State in regards to a Global Resolution. Requests another status.
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darius L Gordon in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Darius L Gordon. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates they have submitted an investigation request in the 19 cases, requests another status date. 
State addresses amended complaint in 2022CF000181 not being addressed at the waiver and provides a copy to defense counsel. 
Defense waives reading, enters NGP. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
NG plea entered.

9:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darius L Gordon appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez for Darius L Gordon appeared in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 

Defense has filed a bond motion on all cases set for today, requesting lower cash.
State objects to any bond modification at this time. 
Motion to modify bond is denied, can refile in front of a Judge.
Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense's
Status conference on March 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Darius L Gordon appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared in court for Darius L Gordon. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense recently appointed, requesting a status.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. 
BTC: Warrants in 19CF573, 19CF647, 20CF1146 AND 21CF1217 are vacated.
